NewWords.WordPhrase: disappoint; fail to help 使失望；不帮助
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I am counting on you to support me; don't let me down.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. look closely or carefully 仔细看
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He peered at me over the top of his glasses.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. feeling anxious or uncertain 不安的，担心的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I am uneasy about this decision.

NewWords.WordPhrase: destroy；become free of 消灭；除去
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I have tried all sorts of medicines to get rid of this cold.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. matter; material 东西；原料
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What is this sticky stuff on the floor?

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. become or make completely wet (使)浸透
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Leave the dirty clothes to soak.
e.g. The sigh was swinging in the wind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. pull (sth. or sb.) along with effort and difficulty 拖，拉，拽
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The protesters were dragged away by the police.
e.g. I have reached the extent of my patience.
e.g. He may be late or, worse still, he may not come at all.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in bad/good physical condition 身体状况差(好)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's been working too hard and she's in pretty bad shape.
e.g. Defeat after defeat filled us with despair.

NewWords.WordPhrase: use part of a supply of 利用；动用
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A writer has to draw on his imagination and experience.
e.g. A rescue team is trying to reach the trapped miners.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the best or most exciting or interesting part 最重要的事件；最精彩的部分   vt. give special attention to 强调，突出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Recorded highlights of today's big football game will be shown after the news.
